summary: The 'Ancient Beast' project, an open-source turn-based strategy game, shows strong alignment with the constitutional principles of fostering community engagement and building local technological capabilities through its open-source model and educational outreach into game development and blockchain. It introduces many to open source and crypto, aligning with Principle 30 and 32. However, its current application lacks explicit integration of Bhutanese cultural heritage (Principle 9, 10, 12) and a clear commitment to environmental sustainability (Principle 17, 18, 19). Furthermore, the project's success metrics are primarily focused on 'mainstream success' and 'generating income,' which do not fully align with the Gross National Happiness principle of measuring success through holistic well-being indicators (Principle 35, 38, 40). The project has potential but needs to deepen its connection to the broader GNH framework.
review:
Ancient Beast presents itself as a compelling open-source, turn-based strategy game with a clear vision for Web3 integration. The project's commitment to being 'easy to learn, fun to play and hard to master' and its emphasis on skill over chance-based elements are commendable, aligning with user-centric design principles. Its open-source model actively fosters community engagement and introduces new individuals to game development and blockchain concepts, which is a significant strength in terms of education and capacity building within the broader ecosystem.

From the perspective of the Takin constitution, the project's open-source nature and focus on community contributions resonate well with the principle of fostering local ownership and capacity building within communities (Principle 7). The stated goal of introducing people to open source, game development, and crypto/blockchains directly supports the integration of technology in education and building local technological capabilities (Principles 30, 32). The game's accessibility and browser-based nature also align with ensuring digital inclusion (Principle 36).

However, the application currently lacks explicit connections to Bhutanese cultural heritage or environmental sustainability. While the project aims for 'mainstream success' and 'generating income,' there is no clear articulation of how success will be measured through holistic well-being indicators, which is a core tenet of Gross National Happiness (Principle 35, 38). The proposed Web3 features, such as 'NFT marketplace' and 'crypto/NFT duels,' are presented primarily from a functional or economic perspective, without detailing how they will contribute to collective well-being or transparent governance in a manner consistent with GNH principles (Principle 40). The 'Coming soon' response for deployer addresses also indicates that the Web3 integration, a key aspect of the 'dApps and Apps' round, is still in early stages of planning rather than implementation.

In summary, Ancient Beast is a promising open-source game with educational potential, but it requires further development in aligning its vision and proposed outcomes with the holistic and culturally sensitive principles of the Takin constitution. A deeper integration of GNH values, particularly in cultural preservation and environmental considerations, would significantly enhance its suitability for this grant.

strengths.title: Strong Open-Source Community Engagement
strengths.description: The project is genuinely open-source and actively encourages community contributions, fostering local ownership and capacity building within the development community. This aligns with Principle 7 (foster local ownership and capacity building) and Principle 37 (build strong community bonds).

strengths.title: Educational Contribution to Open Source and Web3
strengths.description: Ancient Beast introduces new individuals to open-source development, game development, and fundamental concepts of crypto/blockchains and wallets. This directly supports education and building local technological capabilities. This aligns with Principle 30 (integrate technology in education) and Principle 32 (build local technological capabilities).

strengths.title: User-Centric Design and Accessibility
strengths.description: The game is designed to be 'easy to learn, fun to play and hard to master,' browser-based, and works on most common devices, promoting accessibility and digital inclusion. This aligns with Principle 6 (ensure vulnerable groups have meaningful access) and Principle 36 (ensure digital inclusion across geography).

strengths.title: Emphasis on Skill-Based Gameplay
strengths.description: The project's focus on a 'true eSport' without chance-based elements promotes strategic thinking and skill development, which can contribute to critical thinking. This aligns with Principle 33 (promote critical thinking and innovation).

weaknesses.title: Lack of Cultural Heritage Integration
weaknesses.description: The application does not articulate how the project will preserve or promote Bhutanese cultural heritage, local languages, or integrate traditional practices into its digital systems. This is a significant gap concerning Principles 9, 10, 11, and 12.

weaknesses.title: Absence of Environmental Sustainability Focus
weaknesses.description: There is no explicit mention of environmental sustainability efforts, eco-friendly practices, or how technological development will serve environmental conservation goals within the project's scope. This weakens its alignment with Principles 17, 18, and 19.

weaknesses.title: Limited Holistic Well-being Metrics
weaknesses.description: The project's stated goals for success are primarily 'mainstream success' and 'generating income,' which are quantitative economic metrics. This does not align with the constitutional emphasis on measuring success through holistic well-being indicators and prioritizing happiness and peace. This is a weakness regarding Principles 35, 38, and 40.

weaknesses.title: Unclear Web3 Integration Roadmap
weaknesses.description: The response regarding smart contract deployment and blockchain integration is 'Coming soon,' indicating a lack of concrete plans or current implementation for the Web3 components. This suggests the dApp aspect is not yet fully developed or clearly defined, which is a concern for a dApps and Apps round.

changes.title: Cultural Integration
changes.description: Integrate elements of Bhutanese cultural heritage, such as traditional art styles, folklore, or linguistic elements (e.g., Dzongkha terms for units or abilities), into the game's design and narrative. This would strengthen alignment with principles 9, 10, and 12.

changes.title: Environmental Sustainability Plan
changes.description: Provide a clear plan for how the project will address environmental sustainability, particularly concerning the energy consumption of any blockchain components or server infrastructure. This aligns with principles 17, 18, and 19.

changes.title: Holistic Success Metrics
changes.description: Elaborate on how the project will measure success beyond 'mainstream success' and 'generating income.' Define metrics that reflect contributions to community well-being, digital inclusion across diverse geographies, and the fostering of social cohesion, aligning with principles 35, 38, and 40.

changes.title: Detailed Web3 Integration Roadmap
changes.description: Detail the specific roadmap for Web3 integration, including the types of smart contracts to be deployed, their purpose, and how they will ensure transparency and ethical use, as well as benefit the community. This addresses the 'Coming soon' aspect and strengthens alignment with principles 13 and 40.

reasoning: The 'Ancient Beast' project demonstrates strong alignment with principles related to Community Participation and Inclusion (5, 6, 7) through its open-source nature, encouragement of contributions, and accessible design. Its commitment to introducing individuals to open-source development, game creation, and blockchain technology directly supports Education and Knowledge Systems (30, 32, 33). The browser-based and accessible design also contributes to Digital Inclusion (36). However, the application shows significant gaps in addressing Cultural Heritage and Identity (9, 10, 11, 12), Environmental Harmony (17, 18, 19), and the explicit measurement of Holistic Progress (35, 38, 39, 40) beyond economic indicators. While the project is innovative and contributes to the Web3 ecosystem, its current framing does not fully resonate with the comprehensive Gross National Happiness principles that prioritize cultural preservation, environmental stewardship, and collective well-being as central to technological advancement.
